website_summaries.verdict: This model isn't fancy and the phone could be better, but it's an affordable option with an answering machine that has a reasonable amount of recording time.
pros: Can record up to 14 minutes of messages
Compact design fits nicely on desks and countertops
Comes with cordless phone that has backlit caller ID
cons: Some issues with the phone have been reported, including short range and poor sound, but the answer machine works well

customer_reviews.title: I got a dud
customer_reviews.text: Moved into a new home that had horrible cell service so we decided we needed a land line. I bought this phone because of the great price. After the phone company came out and ran the phone line we plugged the phone in, the answering machine portion seemed to work but after letting the hand set charge for over 24 hours we still could not use it. Guess the battery that was supplied was a dud. Since we couldn’t get the phone line installed in a timely manner the time limit for making a return on the phone has passed. Boo.
customer_reviews.author: B.

customer_reviews.title: Display is hard to see, even with backlight.
customer_reviews.text: Even with the screen backlit, it's hard to read unless you are holding the handset. Makes it hard to screen calls.
customer_reviews.author: gondola70

customer_reviews.title: Great clarity and quality
customer_reviews.text: The clarity of this phone is perfect , even for those with hearing aids. It is of great quality and was very easy to set up for use and to hang on wall plaque/jack. The handset is cordless which allows you to move freely around the home when in use. Would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Happy shopper

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and clear sound, but without speaker phone function.
customer_reviews.text: The feel of the phone is good in the hand and against the face. Buttons on this phone are big and easy to use. The signal has good distance and great sound quality. I wear hearing aids and there was no problem there. My biggest dislike of this phone is it has no speaker phone option, but that was stated in the description. After a few weeks of this phone I couldn't do it any more. Had to buy a phone with many of the same features but most important was the speaker phone option. Great buy if you want a good low price phone with good sound, signal and many good features.
customer_reviews.author: kat

customer_reviews.title: Bad sound quality and short range
customer_reviews.text: Older version of the phone. Bad sound quality and short range. Go for the newer versions.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky V.

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: I love that fact that this comes with one handset instead of multiples. Suited my needs to a T. The base and handset have separate ringers (different tones). You can adjust the volume of either or both, or even turn one off altogether. I turned the base ringer off. I've used this for a month now, and haven't come across any real weaknesses. It would be nice if the backlight on the screen was a tad brighter, but I'll not nitpick. There are a half-dozen or so Vtech phones in my family, and no complaints. Great overall performance at a fraction of what you'd pay for ATT, Motorola etc.
customer_reviews.author: water brother

customer_reviews.title: defective -- menu button broken
customer_reviews.text: I returned this after seeking help from the AZ community and the manufacturer, and will be refunded but for the wrong reason, so am writing this review: reason for return, product was defective, not 'not received.' The menu button in the center of the handset should have shown a scrollable menu when pressing the volume up or down keys. The menu should then have revealed 'settings' and adjustments to my preferences could have been made. That was broken. I have since bought an ealier model of this phone that does work, and have also ordered directly from the manufacturer an even older model that seems perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: pen and paper

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: This phone won’t charge and the battery is likely dead. Has been charging over 48 hrs, but won’t come on.
customer_reviews.author: Julie W

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy --  Unreliable !!!
customer_reviews.text: A beautiful phone physically. Sound is very clear, but volume control doesn't go high enough. MANY times, when I speak, the person on the other end can't hear me. (No, the mute button is not on.) Likewise, often when I'm asked to press keys in response to questions asked of me, the key press is not recognized. Very frustrating... Since the trouble of sending it back is a pain in the neck, I'm out the money. Must buy another phone. (I'd always thought VTech made good produsts. My first VTech buy/)
customer_reviews.author: Arizona Bill

customer_reviews.title: A very basic phone with minor issues
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this phone for my sister as a gift since her landline phone broke. I wanted something basic and this phone seemed to do that. I was told that the caller ID didn’t work and at first the ringer was low, but I think my sister was able to get the ringer issue resolved. This phone was cheap and I definitely wanted to get a cordless so it was one of the better ones I could fine. I’m not sure I would buy it again I would probably do more research first. If you want a basic phone and willing to gamble a little with minor issues than this phone may work for you.
customer_reviews.author: Jim and Lupe

customer_reviews.title: Not a good choice fir your main landline phone.
customer_reviews.text: Had to give up on this model, after about 3 months. Difficult to read CID info. Sound poor going out and coming in. Ive had Vtech phones before and now bought an ATT phone made by VTech and quality has and is better than in this model. I would suggest paying more on an upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: kinob

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this product.
customer_reviews.text: Faulty power supply generated loud buzz on this and my two house phones, call answerer not functional, difficult and complicated instructions, useless Customer Support and unreadibly tiny display information displays. Wasted over an hour tracking down numerous product flaws.
customer_reviews.author: R. Inman

customer_reviews.title: It Does What A Phone Should Do
customer_reviews.text: After finally deciding to put a phone in the house, we looked for one that would fit our needs to simply make and receive calls without depending on just the cell phone. The VTech VA17241BK Dect 6.0 Cordless Phone fit the bill. We didn't need a lot of bells and whistles, just a basic phone. Sound quality is decent and the answering machine and Caller ID work well. If you're looking for a simple, inexpensive phone, I have no problems recommending the VTech VA17241BK Dect 6.0 Cordless Phone.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Good cheap option if not using the phone all the time
customer_reviews.text: Functions. Very easy set up, literally just plug it in. Buttons on the handset work when you release them (so they dial when you let go rather than when you push them). This is not a big deal in terms of functioning, but just odd and makes you think it hasn't registered the number you pushed or that it is turning on or off. We really only have the phone for the answering machine in case one of our parents call and for 911 as our cell phones get spotty coverage, so for the price, we are okay with it.
customer_reviews.author: Preppymeetsredneck

customer_reviews.title: My grandma likes it, but its not a good phone
customer_reviews.text: My grandma has had this phone version for her last 3 home phones, each time she gets one the sound quality is bad, the battery life gets worse and the control buttons aren't the easiest to use but she likes it so I keep buying them for her. I guess its simple for older generations to use but I wouldn't buy this for my home phone, its not very good quality and doesn't last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Noah B.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to operate answering machine.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone/answerer for our 92 year old neighbor who had a previous cordless/answerer that no longer worked well. (More than 20 years old). She likes it and I had no problem setting it up for her. She can hear much better on this phone than any other phone extension she has. The only problem I had with it is that the display is not backlit and a bit difficult to see, at times. Your picture shows it backlit but that is not the case and this is the only issue we have with the phone. All things considered, I still give it 4 stars. Would get 5 if the display was backlit.
customer_reviews.author: Larry C

customer_reviews.title: Phone
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone for it's simplicity and ease of use. The only thing I don't like about this, is that the base rings when the phone rings. The base is the answering machine. But other than that, it works like my old V-Tech phone, so my husband didn't have to learn a new system. The answering machine in the base makes for more room on the desk. I like it that the system is easy enough for my 89 year old husband can use it easily. I have had V-Tech phones before and have not had a bit of trouble with them.
customer_reviews.author: KE

customer_reviews.title: Sent back
customer_reviews.text: Our old phone was dying so ordered this one. Sound was very hollow and hard to understand. When pushing the button to dial, the tone was behind the push and echoed in the phone which was a distraction and annoying. The phone sits very erect in the charger while on our table, you had to bend down or pick up the phone to see who was calling. Another annoying thing with all the spam callers. Sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk!
customer_reviews.text: This phone, or at least the one I received, is a piece of garbage. The “menu” button does not bring up anything except answering machine status. I can’t set the time & date, adjust the number of rings before the answering machine kicks on, or any other functions it is supposed to have. Yes, I read the instructions. Sadly, someone n the crew moving my husband into his assisted living apartment threw out the box so I can’t even return it. I will be replacing it with a better brand.
customer_reviews.author: Books 'n Music Forever

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work...
customer_reviews.text: This phone doesn't work anymore, used very few times and less than a month plugged in. The keys are awful, and doesn't respond to answering the call. unfortunately we are past the return time.
customer_reviews.author: Reddy

customer_reviews.title: Can’t see the numbers on the screen
customer_reviews.text: The phone was purchased for my mom. I helped her set it up and saw how small the numbers were on the phone screen. The light and the numbers on the screen makes it so hard to see. If it’s hard for me, it’s definitely harder for my mom. The light sure doesn’t help seeing the numbers any easier on the screen. Also you have to push the button hard enough to actually dial it in. Yes it’s cheap and probably should expect this. I just thought every brand would update the size of the numbers on the screen by now. Should’ve paid extra $5 for a Panasonic. Would return it but threw the box away already.
customer_reviews.author: H.T.

customer_reviews.title: Handset battery failed in less than a year
customer_reviews.text: This is a very basic phone, and for us, that's all we need. But I was surprised that the battery failed so quickly. We had replaced another VTech phone with this one, and had no problems with the old phone for years. Otherwise, a decent basic phone.
customer_reviews.author: Ohio Tina

customer_reviews.title: Nice little phone
customer_reviews.text: I dislike the setup. I set up an older phone but this one the handset doesn’t fit in the base. It says I might need a DSL filter, whatever that is. Didn’t need that with my old Radio Shack phone. Should have bought it from Best Buy. Update: very nice phone to set up; the only problem was with yours truly. I think stress got to me.
customer_reviews.author: Amneris

customer_reviews.title: For the money, it's a great buy.
customer_reviews.text: The phone is easy to program and understand for set up. Works fine except I cannot find a speaker function on the handset. Other than that, I would give it 5 stars. Haven't had it out of the cradle to know about the battery life, but hope it's good!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Crown

customer_reviews.title: Decent. Not my fave
customer_reviews.text: I like the phone itself. Easy set up, not big or bulky. Didn’t read the manual so I don’t know how easy it is to set up all the features (not easy enough that I couldn’t figure it out without the manual). I didn’t like the buttons though it’s almost like the button and beep were off and there was a delay and I feel like k had to push harder for the numbers to register.
customer_reviews.author: Jakki

customer_reviews.title: okay phone
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my folks who still use home phones to replace their old one. Can't figure out why playback keep saying "Time and Date not set" when I have followed the manual and configured it several times already. Build quality is nice and the phone and answering machine base are designed pretty good. Except for the annoying time and date recording problem, I guess it's an okay product for the low cost.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: OK, NO ability to record your own message
customer_reviews.text: I bought for the handset, as I already have a answer machine. Can't record your OWN MESSAGE< FYI. Can't find out how to turn down the ring sound. Easy to use otehrwise.
customer_reviews.author: M Brady

customer_reviews.title: Beware
customer_reviews.text: I am not completely happy with this product. It looks good but there is no light in the box that tells who is calling, so unless there is bright light in the room I had no idea as to whom I would be talking to. I solved this problem by putting a flash light next to the phone . I was also surprised that on the answering machine, I can not leave a message, it is prerecorded. I am keeping the phone since I rarely use the home phone, but I remember reading where someone had given this to their mother. As a senior myself, I would not recommend it for seniors who wish to avoid answering calls from scammers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's really small!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a phone with a handset to replace my Sony. I was rather disappointed upon receiving this Vtech, it's so small. It tips over at the slightest movement and I don't want to connect it to the wall. The price should be lowered, it's definitely not worth $25.00. Sorry.
customer_reviews.author: sorisa77

customer_reviews.title: HARD TO READ SCREEN
customer_reviews.text: It's impossible to see what's on the screen unless you get your face up close directly in front of it, so when it's actively ringing you have to squat down and squint to see who's calling. The super bright red number that indicates how many calls you missed is ideal, they should make the handset screen this way. Also, I can turn down the ringer volume but can't seem to turn down the volume of my voice reciting the recorded message, etc. So, it quietly rings then loudly talks. Not much good when you want to get some sleep.
customer_reviews.author: 3littlesingers

customer_reviews.title: Terrible sound
customer_reviews.text: Lots of features for an inexpensive phone but the sound is the worst I've ever heard. The incoming calls are very artificial sounding and from what I've been told.. the receiver thinks your in a barrel. The system was returned and swapped out for something just a little more upmarket and not the same brand name.
customer_reviews.author: Home shopping savant.

customer_reviews.title: NOT worth it at any price.
customer_reviews.text: Junk!! The first one didn't record the caller so I sent it back to V-Tech to get it replaced. The second one did the same thing as the first one. DON'T buy one. It was a $20 phone that cost me another $10 to ship back to V-Tech. I'm not spending another $10 to ship it back.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: It does what I need it to do
customer_reviews.text: With my internet package I was provided with a free home phone line. I figured I why not use it. I ordered this phone because I only needed one, and this one also had the answering machine attached. The sound quality is not the best. Reason why I docked stars. But, other than that its a good phone.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Love this phone!
customer_reviews.text: I love this phone! It replaced the VTech 5.8 GHz model IA5863. The sound quality, the ringer tones, the volume, the outgoing message, the handset design and the base design are all a huge improvement over the old model. The set up was easy. The sound quality is clear and strong. No more buzzes, static or other sounds. There is a greater selection of ringer tones and volume which was an issue with the old phone. I love the handset. It fits my hand perfectly. It looks great on my desk. I'm really delighted with this phone. I couldn't be happier with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: EB

customer_reviews.title: Not good...
customer_reviews.text: This thing was so bad it moved me to write a review. This may not be the norm so I gave it 2 stars. My first complaint is that the display is horrible...barely readable. Then the sound started to leave me. It got to where I could barely hear the party at the other end. Everything else was okay...easy to operate, loooong battery life, logical menu. But...if you can't hear it... I threw it away and bought a Panasonic...Muuuuch better phone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Land-line must have accessory
customer_reviews.text: If you still have an old land line, this is the ultimate and necessary accessory. Turn off the handset and answering machine ringers and never have to be bothered by robo-calls or sales maniacs or scammers again!! Save your cell number for friends and let others uselessly call this machine. Great value! (for piece of mind, especially)
customer_reviews.author: Edward M Stumpf

customer_reviews.title: Not like presented on box or Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: The display is not readable. I returned product once at suggestion of a VTech rep. I found that the keys of the set lit up with green backlight as shown on the box, but the display did not light. Unless one held the handset in a certain light it was not readable. Unfortunately, I requested an exact replacement and found the same thing in the second phone. I would not buy this product nor can I recommend it. .
customer_reviews.author: Flowers400

customer_reviews.title: Disorganized instructions / documentation
customer_reviews.text: The major problem (that I see) is the format of the set-up instruction sheet. The layout of the information sheet is confusing and disorganized. Set-up directions should be direct and clear what information is provided is poorly organized making the set-up time consuming and needlessly difficult.
customer_reviews.author: John Q. Public

customer_reviews.title: VTech CS6124 DECT 6.0 Cordless Phone
customer_reviews.text: Everything about the phone works well except the LCD display. The display is VERY ,VERY dim. You can barely see any light at all. With my old phone, I could read it from 5-6 feet away.. The VTech display, it is about 1 foot in bright. It is hard for me to believe a company would sell something with a display like this. I
customer_reviews.author: JOE L TENNESSEE

customer_reviews.title: NO FRILLS DEVICE
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. Features it does not have - speaker option on handset - back light for LCD screen It's hard to read - good loudness on handset But I use it for the built-in answering machine. I use my cell phone to make calls. So for me it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Jersey Jim

customer_reviews.title: Priced Right and Works Right
customer_reviews.text: Happy with this product for the price. We just needed a simple handheld set to use for a land line. We chose this because of the price, and the answering machine feature. Had this product for a few months now, and have no complaints about it.
customer_reviews.author: MommaBear23

customer_reviews.title: Everything for a low price
customer_reviews.text: I always brought VTech phones in the past. I needed a new land line phone, and when I saw this one I couldn't believe all the great features for a low price. Works great, I just wish the in coming names and numbers were biger.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Crimmins

customer_reviews.title: I thought it would do things it doesn't do.
customer_reviews.text: I expected it would do things the cell phone does. First of all, I can't see whose clling without glasses and trying to put it in the right light. I can't push a hold button and walk away and still hear when the other party comes back. I can't turn off the ringer. I recieve at least fifteen robocalls a day and would lie to be able to turn off the phone. I have to buy a new phone that will do what I want. I bought a cheaper model to save money. Bad idea.
customer_reviews.author: B. Reser

customer_reviews.title: Waste
customer_reviews.text: I regret not returning this phone everytime I use it. I’m a person who rarely uses my landline that’s why I figured basic no frills would be fine.. wrong /: sound is awful screen image is awful battery life awful and not even a speaker phone.. avoid this one and move on to the next
customer_reviews.author: tm

customer_reviews.title: Hear One -- Hear All!!
customer_reviews.text: Our apartment has been designed so you cannot hear anyone from any room other than the one you are in. This is a good phone and works pretty well with an answering machine as advertised. We should have gone for the one with another satellite phone, but didn't. The only fault with the answering machine is it does not give you any indication it has messages other than just a number indicating how many calls came in while you were out. No tone or beep or anything, if you don't erase them as you hear them, they will just continue accumulating; but that is not the phone's problem, that's yours!! All in all, it's worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Lucky Lady

customer_reviews.title: Works just fine
customer_reviews.text: I was worried after reading some reviews that the phone would not work on menu's where you are required to "press 1 for ..." and "press 2 for..." Some other reviews said that the touch tone would not work on those type menus. I am happy to tell you that it does work just fine. I use this phone along with an "Obi" for google voice and now I have free telephone at home.
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and Works
customer_reviews.text: After years of not having a phone in the home, and carrying two cell phones, one for work, one personal, I decided to retire my "home" cell (so expensive). I love having a home phone again! Who knew? I will probably upgrade later, but it works, takes messages... good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Heart

customer_reviews.title: Better Phones are Out There
customer_reviews.text: Back in the day, VTech phones were the best. Not anymore! First off, the screen is tiny. What’s the use of caller ID if you can’t read who’s calling? Secondly, the line was full of static. Finally, no speed dial. Buy a Panasonic.
customer_reviews.author: Katheryn

customer_reviews.title: Price
customer_reviews.text: The phone is fine, I couldn't rate battery life because I don't know how long it'll last, too soon. For the price, you can't beat the deal.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Castillo

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The telephone is easy to charge and plug in. The screen where you see the telephone numbers is small and poorly lit, so it’s only for people with sharp eyes or you need glasses when you want to make a call. To get to telephone directory takes quite a few steps and I have a feeling that some of the buttons will stop working soon because you need to push them for many different purposes. Not very happy with this model.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does what it should well
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. For a value system I don't have any compliants. The only upgrade would be if it had selectable greetings, meaning you could store 2 or more custom greetings in addition to the standard one and enable or disable as you like. But again, this is a value grade consumer product and I wasn't specifically looking for that option so it's not a negative.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Phone w/ answering system
customer_reviews.text: This Phone is perfect for your home.It rings when you have a call and dials out when you have to make a call without any problem.It also records messages when you cannot get to the phone or are just too busy to answer the phone.Its worth it... I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: localwahine808

customer_reviews.title: It is not very big and it is pretty lightweight. Nothing fancy
customer_reviews.text: You can't beat the price for the product. My mom needed a new phone for her home, but since she does not use it often she did not need something expensive. This phone has an answering machine and caller ID. It is not very big and it is pretty lightweight. Nothing fancy, just a regular phone.
customer_reviews.author: Syane

customer_reviews.title: The phone that does it All :-)
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this phone and answering machine. Soooo glad l purchased it on 9/28/20. Works great and wonderful sound quality and looks beautiful and petite. S.McGee 10/17/20
customer_reviews.author: Sharon McGee

customer_reviews.title: The speakerphone cometh....
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my parents who love it! Especially my mom who discovered she can move around my dad's TV noise and talk to her friends without holding the handset. Now she calls my twice as much as she use to! BRAVO....NOT!!! LOL!!!
customer_reviews.author: akingskid

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend for a cheap deal
customer_reviews.text: It feels kinda lightweight and cheap, but it’s held up quite a while. There’s no speakerphone, but it doesn’t cost a lot. Don’t expect bells and whistles. Call clarity is fine. It’s basically as you would expect for a phone at this price. We used it with Comcast at first and then a Magic Jack. No problems so far.
customer_reviews.author: Delaware

customer_reviews.title: Good little phone set up.
customer_reviews.text: Not having had a landline in many years, I was a bit spoiled coming into this. There's few customizable ring options, it's pretty loud when it rings, and it doesn't do speakerphone. That said, it does precisely what it says on the box and I am glad to have it around as a backup in case of cellphone failure.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Ragle

customer_reviews.title: Good range, that's about it
customer_reviews.text: The phone works okay. Sometimes the 1 button does not press on the first try, and the 5 button is recessed in further than the other buttons. I know it was not listed as a feature but there is no speaker phone option so you are stuck with it to your ear. The answering macine works well and it has a good range, I can use it anywhere inside and outside of my house.
customer_reviews.author: Acompst

customer_reviews.title: A simple , basic phone
customer_reviews.text: The phone works fine . It's a replacement phone . First one not bought in Amazon. Can't speak of the battery life .
customer_reviews.author: Terrific Aunt

customer_reviews.title: Not satisfied at all
customer_reviews.text: I have a phone for over 10 years from the same company and it was perfect no the cable the charging cable is not good and it doesn’t have a answering machine so I got this one but it’s not even close the voice is very unclear
customer_reviews.author: Genc

customer_reviews.title: Easy to understand and use. Light up numbers, nice display size
customer_reviews.text: Works great, easy to follow instructions. Answering machine function is wonderful, easy to see when there is a message waitiing. No numbers to dial to get messages. Back to what works and tossed out the AT&T cordless.
customer_reviews.author: Arizona Grandma

customer_reviews.title: For the price of it it’s worth it and you have a nice phone in your home.
customer_reviews.text: Very good little phone to use in your house, the battery lasts for a long time especially when you don’t talk a lot on it. I’m not a big phone person, maybe I receive three calls a day or I make a call myself. It also charges fast as well and easy to set it up.
customer_reviews.author: Eva Pop

customer_reviews.title: has no speaker feature
customer_reviews.text: i like to put my phone on speaker while on hold so i don't have to hold the phone up to my ear for the whole time while waiting for a representative and this phone won't let you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: I found it difficult to program the name directory at first but once I got that down it became easy to use. I like having an answering machine that I can glance at instead of calling inorder to find out if I have any messages.
customer_reviews.author: Li P

customer_reviews.title: Phone works for elderly mom
customer_reviews.text: My mom needed a simple, easy to use phone & this is the best option for her. She was able to set the phone up by herself & use it right away. The sound quality is good so she is very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Bella

customer_reviews.title: this is our Second Vtech answering machine. It replaces a 15 year old one
customer_reviews.text: The old one worked trouble free for many years. Recently incoming messages became distorted. Two other Vtech cordless phones are about 15 years old, and still work perfectly. Only batteries had to be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: J.Scott 6

customer_reviews.title: Too quiet
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my father in law because you couldn't hardly hear outta his old one. To our surprise, this wasn't any better. Volume is not hard of hearing friendly on phone, & doesn't have speaker phone.
customer_reviews.author: Kimi Rocha

customer_reviews.title: Great phone for price but...................
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this phone a better review as I have had VTech products in the past which was the deciding factor for purchasing this phone. I needed a simple phone, DECT 6 technology for a phone line I don't often use. I needed the answering machine also. However, the phone works great except one thing, the phone does not have a back light on the display. It maybe that my phone is defective. I only paid some $20 dollars for it and figured it was to much hassle to return. Guess I don't need to see who's calling or who I'm dialing. Whatever.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Reems

customer_reviews.title: Just the home phone I needed
customer_reviews.text: This is a basic and inexpensive phone with all the features I was looking for at an excellent price. It may not meet everyone's needs or expectations, but it does the job for me. It sounds clear over VOIP and setup was a breeze. It's not very impressive in terms of design or ergonomics but that was not high on my list of priorities. If you want something flashier, there are probably a lot of other options available.The keys are the right size and illuminate, the LCD is large enough and the ringer volume is adjustable to suit me. If it lasts at least 5 years I'll be very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Rictango

customer_reviews.title: VTech cordless phone
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my elderly parents. They are happy with the phone and my mother says she can hear better on it then she could their old phone. The screen is a bit small and they have trouble reading it, it doesn't light up very bright. But other then that it seems to be a good phone.
customer_reviews.author: georgia radel

customer_reviews.title: VTech Cordless Answering System
customer_reviews.text: We had a terrible time with a previous VTech Cordless Answering System that we bought about 4 years ago. We could never work the buttons on the old system, whereas this system is very simple, clearly marked and intuitive as to which button to push to get the results you want done. Play, Rewind, Delete, etc. We highly recommend this product for home use.
customer_reviews.author: J.L. SMITH

customer_reviews.title: Really Nice, Simple And Inexpensive Cordless Phone/Answering Machine.
customer_reviews.text: Really great, compact and simple cordless phone! Easy setup. Really nice if you just need a simple cordless phone/answering machine. No big deal but you cannot record your own answering message. The machine greets the caller with a built in simple message.
customer_reviews.author: ILoveLivingRural

customer_reviews.title: If you need a speaker phone, this one is not!
customer_reviews.text: I thought all of these phones had a speaker on them but I thought wrong as this one doesn't which my 83 year old friend must have so I had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Great look and feel - Easy setup!
customer_reviews.text: This phone was simple to set up and start using. Nice loud ring for those of us hard of hearing. Good volume control while in conversations. Comes with preset answering machine outgoing message. Yay! I didn't have to record my own. Nice feel in the hand, not too heavy.
customer_reviews.author: TorieT

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: My land line is seldom used and really just for emergencies and to put on websites for telemarketers. Works fine for what I paid for it. If you use yours to make and receive more than a few calls a month, I would get something different.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin K. Knierim

customer_reviews.title: Terrible phone
customer_reviews.text: I returned it. Kept jumping from how many rings I wanted, volume so low I could barely hear, info sheet given was useless. I got more info from the website than what was sent to me. Basically, a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Cat lover

customer_reviews.title: If you like the ability to set the handset down and talk ...
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize they still made phones without a speaker phone mode built into the handset. Perhaps that is my own fault and I should have been aware enough to look for that feature explicitly. Don't make the same mistake I did. If you like the ability to set the handset down and talk via speaker phone, look elsewhere. Otherwise the phone works as expected. Voicemail, caller ID, etc. all function fine. No complaints besides the speakerphone omission.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Stafford

customer_reviews.title: Very glitchy
customer_reviews.text: This phone seemed like a good, basic phone for a good price. I got it for our landline which we use once a week tops....and even using it that little, I've had an issue with it every time! It freezes, and nothing you do will unfreeze it (no buttons work), so you have to just put it back on the base and wait. Usually it's better in 30 minutes. Wish I paid a little extra for a better quality phone, this one is a waste of money unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: SJ2016

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working for no reason - cheap tat.
customer_reviews.text: Handset just does't pick up the dial tone anymore. No idea why. It's "on" otherwise, lights up. Won't buy vtech again.
customer_reviews.author: Padma Sangjay Llamo

customer_reviews.title: No headset jack
customer_reviews.text: Was disappointed. I needed a phone that could have a headset plugged into it. Web site suggested I buy a headset with it, only reason I was buying a phone was because I needed to be able to plug in a headset. This "suggested" additional purchase should be removed from this product since it is misleading. My money was returned
customer_reviews.author: Christine Steele

customer_reviews.title: Junk, I plugged it in it didn't want to ...
customer_reviews.text: Junk, I plugged it in it didn't want to work right away I thought it was me, so I got it to work. A few days later I tried to use it its not working again. The answering machine wont even turn on, when people try to call it rings on there end nothing here. and its a very cheap phone if I had not got rid of the box I would return it. JUNK.
customer_reviews.author: bert

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, easy to use, clear directions, and looks good!
customer_reviews.text: Great phone for the price! I was able to figure out the set-up without any assistance and I'm pretty technologically challenged (e.g., I can use a computer without any problem, but I can't set anything up, have trouble finding files I saved, etc.)--this phone is a piece of cake. Directions were obviously written by someone whose first language is English. Looks nice and clean and crisp white, too.
customer_reviews.author: HvnSnt

customer_reviews.title: Can’t reply to automated button entry requests!
customer_reviews.text: There is no speakerphone nor will automated button reply’s register. If your pharmacy or doctor office calls to confirm appt or meds and they ask “press 1 for blah blah” they will not recognize the entry from this phone...
customer_reviews.author: Holly A.

customer_reviews.title: Good for Price
customer_reviews.text: I have no problem with this phone. Just wanted a home phone in case my cell phone was not working. I'm happy with it. It's small, cute and working just fine.
customer_reviews.author: C. N.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: I like the phone . It works well, but I had a phone of the same brand and it had gotten a lot of static on it. I hope this phone is better.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Poland

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP PIECE OF JUNK
customer_reviews.text: Don't make the mistake I did and buy the cheapest phone out there. Can't be programmed, directions are useless, the cheap speaker sounds tinny, it's so lightweight you can't really get a good grip on it. In a word: Yucky. We threw ours away.
customer_reviews.author: M. R. Sheffield

customer_reviews.title: Very light weight phone. Toylike
customer_reviews.text: This phone is so light weight that I had to stick it to the table with 3m sticker. Is like a kid toy weight but other than that ok
customer_reviews.author: kawaii

customer_reviews.title: Its a phone, can place and receive calls with an answering machine as well.
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, its a phone? I can send and receive calls and play my messages through my handset as well. Don't expect all the bells and whistles since it is a plain phone. It meets my needs and hopefully it will last me a long time. Before you buy it, read all of the features. Don't expect a speaker phone on your handset, or a headphone jack either. I just want it to place calls and when I am not a home my answering machine will get it.
customer_reviews.author: Efrain

customer_reviews.title: MOST RELIABLE PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: My first experience with a Vtech phone was 15 years ago. That phone lasted for 10 years. My last phone had to be replaced after several years only because my granddaughter put it in the toilet. So I now have purchased another phone/answering machine. I would never buy any other product but Vtech .
customer_reviews.author: J. Sauter

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my parents to replace another one. Good so far. Like that you can press a button to locate the phone. The menu controls are good and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Cheetahfox

customer_reviews.title: Good quality phone, not bad for the price.  No bells and whistles, but it is user friendly.
customer_reviews.text: Affordable and easy to keep around the house as a back up plan. Wish I could put it on speaker or even add a hands-free option, but for the price to sit there and look pretty, its ok :) I have a poor cellphone signal and service drops calls on a regular basis. This phone is a great option when I have to make important phone calls when I'm home. Anyone else, it's ok to drop a call or two and blame it on the mobile carrier :D J/kidding :)
customer_reviews.author: RitaL

customer_reviews.title: Landline phone
customer_reviews.text: I have used this brand before. It works well and seems to last a long time. I had to buy a replacement since a friend dropped the receiver in the toilet. Some of the instructions are worded weirdly..
customer_reviews.author: Connie Martinson

customer_reviews.title: cannot record a personalized message.  Should not be this complicated
customer_reviews.text: You shouldn't have to wonder if you can record a personalized message on an answering machine. This wasn't even something I wondered about when purchasing this for my brother
customer_reviews.author: tjfoster62

customer_reviews.title: Does what it needs to -
customer_reviews.text: Good price for a good product. If like the previous one I bought for a friend it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy with a K

customer_reviews.title: Not what we wanted.
customer_reviews.text: We sent this back it was not what we thought it was. I wanted one to mount to the wall this did not.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry

customer_reviews.title: Ability to get nesssges
customer_reviews.text: I have used your product when I used to have land line. I gave up on lsndclibes adicwas traveling a lot until I decided to settle fien in a house I bought three months ago. I decided to use ksbdcljbe in addition to my mobile
customer_reviews.author: Kasi

customer_reviews.title: Phone
customer_reviews.text: I had this phone for 2 days. It worked fine. In the middle of a phone call, the phone froze. I could not get it to work again.Unfortunately, had to return. And I really liked this phone.
customer_reviews.author: mham61

customer_reviews.title: Awesome v-tech cordless
customer_reviews.text: It was a Christmas present for my grandmother. She is happily owner of cordless phone. Her very first phone that are cordless she is 93. She’s so pleased! Fast shipping!
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Greer

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality and Expensive
customer_reviews.text: The phone was bought to replace the phone instrument in my kitchen. It meets the basic phone making/answering role, recording voice messages and is doing all that fine for the moment. V-tech products are generally of good quality and I have used them several times in the past too. The only reason I have given it 4 starts is because it is very expensive (considering it is a single instrument and has only very basic features).
customer_reviews.author: NiDu

customer_reviews.title: LCD Screen Did Not Light Up
customer_reviews.text: Basically a useless phone. It is my first Vtech product. Vtech support determined it was defective. They did not offer to send a new one under warranty. The phone is four days old.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: VTech VA17241BK Dect 6.0 Cordless Phone with Answering System and Caller ID, Wall-Mountable, Black
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Pattern Name:Cordless PhoneWith up to 14 minutes of recording time, The VTech VA17241BK DECT 6. 0 expandable cordless Phone with Answering system and caller ID grabs calls when you can't. The lighted display indicates how many new messages you have waiting. Caller ID entries display on a large, backlit LCD screen so you can see who’s on the line even in the dark. This phone stores up to 30 calls so you can review who called while you were out. Place the system on a table or mount it to a wall. Using DECT 6. 0 technology, the VTech VA17241BK DECT 6. 0 expandable cordless Phone with Answering system and caller ID gives you private, interference-free sound from any room in your home.
feature_bullets: Digital Answering system: with up to 14 minutes of recording time, the digital Answering system grabs calls when you can't.
Caller ID/Call waiting—stores 30 calls: know who's calling with Caller ID/Call Waiting. Handset displays the name, number, time and date of incoming calls.
Backlit keypad and display: the keypad and LCD screen illuminate so you can easily make and view calls, even in dim light.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars10,745 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
